cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles SW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northward through the Gulf, then turning northeast after landfall and sweeping up the U.S. East Coast toward the North‐east and Atlantic Canada

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Alabama-Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Tropical Storm Watch from Suwannee River to Anna Maria Island FL and AL-MS border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Pinar del Rio (Cuba); Tropical Storm Warning Isle of Youth (Cuba) and Tulum-Cabo Catoche (MX); Storm-Surge Watch Navarre FL to Anna Maria Island FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then across GA/SC/NC and northward along the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coastline
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25-35 mph possible as the system passes Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston according to current advisory
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized amounts up to ~6 inches possible Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal flooding at high tide and hazardous rip currents are possible during passage
